Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel..”
Reviews.Author: evren p
Reviews.Content: I have stayed @ Le Marquis last weekend for a short city break and absolutely loved it. Booked directly from their website, also comunicated with staff / manager before / after booking. They have been very helpful, extremely polite and professional. We have stayed in an executive room, with an Eiffel Tower view and great decoration. Location is amazing. 5 minutes walk from the Metro, 10 minutes walk from Eiffel Tower, lots of cafes, bistros, shops around. If you visit Paris as a couple, and would like to stay in a nice, cosy, romantic, modern hotel, close to Eiffel, choose Le Marquis. I won't look for any other hotel for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: GrillVogel
Reviews.Content: Perfect for our weekend trip...less than 1km from Eiffel Tower, Parc du Champs de Mars, and Ecole Militaire. Quiet street; several Metro stations within a 5-10 minute walk. Our "superior room" was small but quite comfortable for two. Consistently friendly & helpful reception staff, beginning from the time we booked our reservation (they made immediate contact by email). Honestly, no complaints--it seemed like a well-run hotel & we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Base of Exploration”
Reviews.Author: Metts_39056
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in this hotel while exploring Paris. The walk to the metro stop is a little longer than you'll want to hike with all your luggage, but less than 10 minutes. Just spring for a cab on the way in and out. It's a short hike to the Tower, or the Metro, or tour bus stops. It's a small, very modern hotel on a quiet side street. We could see the very tip of the tower from our room, but don't expect great views. The rooms are small, but scrupulously clean. The staff speaks good English, and was very helpful with directions and dining suggestions. Not quite a destination in itself, but a very nice place to stay while you explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: loulav c
Reviews.Content: Very nice and classy hotel. Good size room and VERY COSY. I would go back there for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “It's "duplex" not "dooplay"!”
Reviews.Author: Twnsnry
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a three night stay at Hotel Le Marquis. As with most places there are positive and negative attributes. Let's start with the positive! The Hotel location worked out fine for us. The bakery on the corner and the grocery store across the street were convenient but I do wish the bakery had coffee. We got coffee on a tray from the hotel bar and it cost 10E. I also liked that it was a residential neighborhood so we could get a feel for everyday parisian life. There is a school and park close by too.The walk to the Eiffel Tower was just 10 minutes and nice to stroll through the park around it. We did rack up some high taxi fares though to get to and from parts of the city but I'm not sure any other hotel would be different. We liked the L'Open Bus Tour which left from the Eiffel Tower. The exterior of the hotel was beautiful and our room (#406) was clean and efficient. We always got good service and it was quiet. The negatives were the room size, a bit small but fine for three nights. The room was quite dark too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: CharleeMarcus
Reviews.Content: A fabulous hotel, friendly, helpful staff, great location, Would highly recommened to anyone wanting a romantic break. Our room had a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower, which on a night we could watch the lights. The room was a good size and the bathroom was clean and bigger than expected.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: evon20
Reviews.Content: very nice boutique hotel, well located, pretty rooms and good shops/bakeries around. I had a lovely stay over there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location to see Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: lucyks
Reviews.Content: For my birthday my boyfriend booked this hotel as my birthday present. After reading the reviews on here I wasn't sure what to expect. I agree with some but then I disagree with others. We stayed 3 nights and I thoroughly enjoyed it! This hotel is in a great location to visit the monuments/land marks you would want to see in Paris. The walk to the Eiffel Tower is literally 5mins. There are m any places to eat along the main road the hotel is just off of. A great bakery on the main road, on a corner. Definitely would reccommend! It has pink decor and pink chairs outside...look out for it. The breakfast is from 7:30-10:30am which is great as one day we woke up early and could go and get breakfast and then another day we woke up later and relaxed in bed for a bit and still had time to go and get breakfast. There's a selection of meat, cheeses, bread, crossants and cereals. Our breakfast came with our room as we went through a site that done a package deal. The room was a decent size, quite big I thought. Comfy beds, lots of space in the wardrobe. A safe that you choose the code to store your valuables. Clean room. The cleaner that cleaned the rooms everyday was very friendly and kind even though we spoke little French. You get lovely white towels supplied and dressing gowns and slippers. The only thing that wasn't as good as I thought was when we arrived, our room wasn't ready, we arrived at 5pm and check in was meant to be any time from 3pm. The lady we checked in with was friendly but the other man wasn't and complained about us in French as our room was made up as a twin room when we asked for a double. They just said to push the beds together which meant it was easy to fall down the middle and we had two single duvets. In the morning we asked if we could change rooms, the man on the reception desk was very lovely and said that was absolutely fine and apologised. Problem was solved and our next nights sleep were very comfortable. I would recommend this hotel. I wouldn't quite say it was 4 star but it is clean and comfortable and the majority of the staff are very friendly and so helpful. We had a great weekend and this hotel would be great for exploring Paris.

Reviews.Title: “short vacation”
Reviews.Author: Andreea S
Reviews.Content: Hey! Me and my husband wanted to spend 3 days in Paris, but we wanted a good hotel. This one is acceptable, but has some faults. It is small and the standard room(which is pretty expensive) is extremely small. The bathroom too....if you are athletic, you can forget about it. Breakfast was good, but you couldn't ask anything from the kitchen, as if they didn't have one. The staff was pretty horrible. We asked for an upgrade but the assistant manager said we can forget about it. Even so, the location is very good, the metro station is near....maybe some don't have so many expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in an inviting neighbourhood in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Juledan
Reviews.Content: For a romantic get-a-way we stayed one night in Paris. We booked straight from the hotel website and got a 50% discount. Parking was possible in a nearby supermarket parking for 15 euro per night (which in Paris is good value). Note: per night means only after six o'clock at night you pay another 15 euro. As we stayed one night we could leave the car parked until far in the afternoon which was enough for us to explore Paris a little more. Now the hotel itself is nicely decorated and I would say a four star boutique hotel. We did miss the bathrobe and the tea and coffee making facilities but then again this is continental Europa :-). We booked a classique room which was on par to Parisian standards: small but large enough to not feel uncomfortable. The tv was good although it had a mostly French channel selection (we didn't mind that). The hotel offers breakfast, roomservice and a minibar but we didn't make use of it so it is hard to rate (prices are what you can expect in a four star hotel in Paris: on the high end). The staff was friendly and helpful although there was only one staff member who spoke well enough English. She also helped us making reservations for a restaurant. The location is good and actually although we have been many times to Paris we never stayed in this part of the city. We liked it a lot and next time we will book a hotel (perhaps this one) in this area again. The metro stop is just a five minutes walk away from the hotel. Around this metro station there are many interesting shops, restaurants and bars. Also (at least one sunday) there is a lovely market. We didn't see many tourists in here so that is also a good thing :-).

Reviews.Title: “This wonderful hotel was our honeymoon home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: sunico
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Paris, at Hotel le Marquis, and we loved it. The neighbourhood was wonderful - very quiet, not overly touristy, and within a five minute walk of the Eiffel Tower. We were seconds from so many wonderful restaurants and cafes, and just around the corner from a Metro stop. The staff at the hotel were so friendly and helpful, and the coffee was amazing! Our room, while a little on the small side, was clean, well-appointed, and had a view of the Eiffel Tower. Breakfast and room service were a little over-priced, but otherwise this hotel really made our stay in Paris even more amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Already planning our next trip”
Reviews.Author: RayBansBoy
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel could not have been more friendly and helpful. The location is a nice 5 minute stroll to the Eiffel tower or in the opposite direction to the metro. Location was great, breakfast was relaxed and did the trick to keep us going through the miles of walking we did. The room was clean, spacious (especially for Paris) and very quiet at night, the beds were also very comfy.

Reviews.Title: “lovely boutique hotel,would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: jgrierson
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel to take my mother on a trip to paris. it is lovely and ideally situated for visiting the sites. The room was a reasonable size by paris standards and we had a little balcony although only a few rooms have these so you would need to request, the balcony isnt big enough to sit on but you can open the french windows and sit beside them looking onto the street below. the room itself was beautifully decorated and the bed large and comfortable. there is a mini bar and television but the only downside was not coffee making facilities so we had to order room service if we wanted coffee whuch was expensive and the waiter then stood expecting a tip. The room service quality and price though is pretty good.The breakfast cost 16euro so was expensive for what you get but all of paris is so we took it. Bathrrom was lovely and room kept immaculate by maid so cant fault here at all. To visit attractions, 1st eiffel tower:come out of hotel and turn right for about 100yards to main road, then left and keep walking and you come to tower. for centre and sacre couer area, instead turn left when you come out and walk up through place dupleix and past the little park and church to main road and get the metro(you are on line 6) take this to centre which is last stop,then change to line 2 for centre or line 1 for sacre couer,itsd all very clear and the locals are incredibly helpful. one tip is dont bother buying the 3 day transport pass you dont really get value for money unless you are really in tune with using system.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and very good Location”
Reviews.Author: REMACK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the full week of our Paris holiday. The Hotel is very quaint and quiet. Our rooms were very clean and comfortable, they were a bit small but what we expected for hotels in Europe. The staff was extremely helpfull and made sure we had everything we needed. The location was everything we could have wanted. It was a block and a half from the Eiffel Tower Park and very close to Metro stations and lots of Resturants.

Reviews.Title: “Kind personnel, but expensive room”
Reviews.Author: taxideutis
Reviews.Content: While the room was very clean, we found that the price (149 eur) was too expensive for a small room placed at the back side of the hotel, with a view to the back of other buildings. The personnel was very nice, kind and helpful, leaving a very positive image of the hotel services.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel,was a rip off and for the cost it took to get into paris centre i could of stayed at hte ritz.”
Reviews.Author: englandisbestcom
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in luxury hotels worldwide i felt ripped off by the marquis,so much so I left two days early and lost the money i`d paid.from the start i was`nt helped through the door with my luggage and was left in the lobby for over an hour while the room was prepared.The staff were rude and unhelpful and would`nt even call a taxi for me,after checking out the concierge let me struggle through the door again and was most uhelpful.Don`t believe the hype on there website,they were pathetic and rude and unproffesional.Do yourself a favour and stay at the ritz/grand etc and enjoy your stay in paris

Reviews.Title: “Pursuit of Excellence”
Reviews.Author: August519
Reviews.Content: Let me just prefix this review by saying, I use to be an executive with a large corporation that put an extra strong emphasis on taking customer service to a new level. We were the corporation that everyone else looked up to and tried to match our level of customer service. Le Marquis Eiffel has achieved a level of excellence in customer service. If they were a restaurant, they would have three star Michelin rating. Let me give you a few examples. If we wanted help getting to a specific location, they would pull out a map and highlight where we were, where our destination was. Then tell us our options as far walking, taking the metro/rer or boat. The AC power adapter I bought in the U.S. didn't work. Once again, they found an adapter they had and let me use it. I had trouble putting money on my french sim card. Once again they stepped up and helped me reload my sim card. Although I took french many years ago, anytime I had a question about the language, I'd get a help with pronunciation and meaning. This is the first hotel I have stayed at that has reached this level of customer service

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little place....”
Reviews.Author: GermanKatze
Reviews.Content: After having some pretty bad hotel experiences in Paris, we had low expectations. Living in Germany, you become accustomed to a different level of quality and well frankly, France just isn´t up to par unless you can afford 600 euros and up per night. Well, I cannot say anything but good things about Le Marquis. Aside from the friendliest staff EVER, the rooms are very nice, clean and above average in my opinion. The rate even included breakfast, which is not an easy find in Paris. The breakfast is nothing special, but it was fresh and had plenty to choose from. I definitely recommend this place and it will be my hotel of choice upon my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Gold11LA_California
Reviews.Content: friendly staff, clean & quiet rooms, food ok but good restaurants in the area. Super location (5min walk to the Eifel Tower) and about 10min drive from Garde Nord Trainstation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: DvTh
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend stay in Paris. The hotel is in a great location - in a quiet safe neighborhood just a minute stroll from the Eiffel Tower. A perfect central location. The hotel clean, the beds and (enough pillows) are good quality and although the rooms small, they are comfortable. The staff in the hotel was not overly friendly but was helpful when asked. As the inhabitants of Paris are not well known for their friendliness we were not put off by reception's attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced & Pretentious”
Reviews.Author: taz100
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a lovely three night stay in wonderful Paris. We booked the flights and hotel through Thomas Cook/Expedia. We arrived at the hotel and immediately I realised that this was a hotel trying to be something it most certainly wasn't. We stood at reception and were ignored by receptionist (a good start) whilst she was on telephone. The bystanding member of staff only stepped in once I began to get really hacked off and let out a rather large sigh! We were taken to our room, which was absolutely tiny, but clean. The en suite was certainly not of 4 star quality and also tiny. We had a window which looked out to an internal view. On the plus side, the bed was comfortable. However only three pillows for two people and no in room tea/coffee facilities. I enquired at reception to see if we would be able to get an extra pillow, to be told that there were no extra pillows in the hotel!!! This hotel could never be classed as over friendly and any member of staff showing any kind of friendliness did so with an air of smarmy-ness. No genuinely friendly people here. We would never return to this hotel as there are hundreds of much better hotels in this beautiful city. If you are thinking of booking this hotel, my advice would be to keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “excellent quiet area - 2nd stay in a period of two years”
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights .The area is great , walking distance from the Eiffel tower . Near the metro stations - Dupleix and The Motte Piquet . We have stayed there 2 years ago again , this time the hotel looked more unfriendly ... The staff is polite but a bit cold . The thing that annoyed me most was that during hours 12.00- 15.00 in the afternoon were still cleaning rooms and it was very noisy . Breakfast is good , they have wonderfull china and l'occitane stuff in the bathrooms . I woulddefinetely recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “If the pictues of hotel rooms deceive you, this will deceive you the most.”
Reviews.Author: Minty_Fresh_10
Reviews.Content: If you are a tiny heightwise, this place is not so bad. My friend and I are tiny, but we have huge luggages! The room is so small it's as if I was trying to get dressed in an office cubicle. The decor is fancy and the bathrooms, although small, give you the great feeling that you are in Paris. Perhaps they put too much decor in their rooms making it seem tiny? They use L'Occitane shampoos, soaps, etc. Love it! I took some home. The concierge at the lobby are friendly, but not great at solving problems. Upon our arrival the first thing I wanted to do was eat and take a shower. Unfortunately their hot water tank was broken and they failed to let us know during check in. Other than that, they're really friendly. The location is great! Just a few block away from the metro, grocery, wine store and best of all the eiffel tower. It is also just steps away from a bike rental depo so if you decide to bike around town you can always park it there before you checkout or go back into your room. I'm not so sure I got my money's worth staying here. There are other places around Paris that are a lot cheaper and have a similar ambiance , but if you like a quiet central area this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jeff.francis
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at this hotel and we were not disappointed The hotel is in a great spot, approximately 5 minutes from the tower. The rooms are very pleasant with excellent facilities and fixtures. I would recommend the hotel and would return again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: gpmaribel
Reviews.Content: This cozy hotel is perfectly located on a quiet street near the Eiffel Tower in Paris. It's about a 5-10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and there is a bakery at the corner to the left which makes the best pain au chocolat ever!! They were so good, we had one every morning during our 5 day stay. Across the street there is also a supermarket fully stocked with whatever you need; meats, cheeses, wine, cereals, general groceries and a pharmacy. The metro station is not too far either. You can access either the Dupleix stop or the Grenelle stop they're both about the same distance away..about 10 minutes walking and you can get anywhere in Paris on their metro system. The only negative thing I must say about the hotel is that the room was a bit on the small side even for European standards, but the service, the comfort, and the location more than made up for it. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “quaint, parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnimalLvr
Reviews.Content: The Le Marquis was exactly what we were looking for. It is a small hotel, with very nice public areas and clean, comfortable rooms which were roomy by Paris standards. The photos are very accurate. The staff was kind and helpful. The breakfast was very nice, but very pricey if not included in your room rate. The coffee is great and served with steamed milk on request. A nice market, bakery, and laundromat are right outside the door. We loved this neighborhood, but be aware that the metro and main area to eat and shop are about a ten minute walk away. Once there, many options are available. The street between McDonald's and Monoprix is great for shopping. Many cafes in this area too. On Wednesday and Sunday vendors set up booths under the metro on Blvd. Grenelle. We look forward to returning to Le Marquis.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with great staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: karfie
Reviews.Content: Le Marquis is ideally situated near 2 metro stations and is about a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, making it really handy to get around. The area itself is very quiet which makes it feel nice and peaceful, perfect for a relaxing trip with your partner. We were greeted by friendly staff who kindly upgraded us to a deluxe room, as it was our 1st wedding anniversary, so we were impressed with this. The room was larger than expected given the reputation Paris has for small hotel rooms. Our room had a little balcony facing out to the front of the hotel, no great view but still felt like a nice feature. The toiletries in the room were L'Occitane, and if you are a beauty product fan like me you will know this is top quality stuff! I was quite excited about this...not everyone cares about these things I understand! If you’re a girl like me you might ;-) I have to say I’m a little puzzled by the previous review regarding the bathroom as I thought ours was quite modern and there was certainly nothing to complain about. Maybe other travellers are used to staying in the Ritz or some other mega fancy place but by our standards Le Marquis was pretty plush. Breakfast was buffet style, with a choice of your usual continental fayre but there was also bacon, sausages and scrambled eggs and a choice of making your own boiled eggs. The croissants, pancakes, pain au chocolat etc were all yum. A great way to start your busy day sightseeing. The one drawback is that there is no tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms, however if you fancy a cuppa when you get back to the hotel the reception staff are more than happy to make you a fresh pot to either have up in your room or in the lounge. Or in the courtyard outside if the weather is nice. And they steam the milk for you ;-) just little touches you don’t get everywhere. And it was free of charge. If you’re looking to do something special we would recommend the Bateaux Parisiens dinner cruise which was the highlight of our trip. It’s pricey but worth it. Take note husbands, it would be a lovely surprise for your wife!!! Things to look out for – taxi drivers! Make sure you agree a price before you get in and have a good grasp of French as they may not speak English.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: Ponora
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location. The Eiffel tower is about a 15 minute walk away and the area surrounding the hotel is very safe and conveniently located opposite a supermarket. The room we had was clean and tidy, and came equipped with an ensuite bathroom, mini-bar, TV and DVD player. There were, however, a couple of negative points: the lighting in the room was inadequate and our room looked very dark and gloomy even during the day. In addition, the rail above the bed was very dusty and should have been better cleaned. The "reception" of the hotel was basically an office desk manned by a very studious-looking young man who was so absorbed in what he was doing, he failed to even greet us when we first walked into the hotel. Overall, I think the staff should have been more friendly and welcoming. Despite this, the service provided was generally very good and I really enjoyed my stay here. I would definitely recommend Hotel Le Marquis to anyone going on a siteseeing trip to Paris due to the highly convenient and safe location.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are small, no hanging space, poor breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: BlackburnAndy
Reviews.Content: Would I stop there again? Definitely. The Hotel is a nice building from the outside and inside is very nicely decorated. The staff i have to say where excellent. Very helpful, professional and polite even the guy who ran the breakfast although i would have liked him to just once, that's all come and ask us if we wanted a tea or cofee rather than me having to call him and ask him for one. Was a nice fella though. The room itself is small and the nice french doors opened on to another building which was a disappointment but it's not as if you are going to spend any great deal of time in there. Nice modern rooms and bathroom again very nicely decorated and clean. The location of the hotel for me was perfect. Down a nice quiet street away from all the hustle and bustle but still close to the metro and also our favourite monument the eiffel tower. I would recommend this hotel. It's good value for what i paid and is just a very comfortable and enjoyable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Hilton but a really really good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BurgiKing
Reviews.Content: Firstly a lot of negative reviews about the hotels in France have become quite Irritating. All I ever here is people complaining about the size of the rooms... unfriendly people... noisy locations. Ignore them! France is about busy nights, lots of bed wrestling and eating nice food/getting tipsy. People who are looking for a hotel to spend the whole holiday in are insane! ~Rant over Hotel~ Booked this hotel with the misconception it would be 'run-down', 'manky' etc. but on arrival it was beautiful. Very clean. The staff were helpful, although they are quietly spoken. I took my own case because i am not an invalid or royalty. We got to the room and were suprised at how nice it was. It's got a nice low light that gives a nice atmosphere. It is small. Bathroom is nice, the bath is small however and could fit me and my lass in but it we're below 6ft. The bedroom was cleaned thoroughly and it was refreshing every night we returned. We did not have breakfast or do any room service because we're penny pinchers. Location~ Nice quiet location, supermarket. Cafe's all over the place which aren't too pricey. Eiffel tower is walking distance (7-10 minutes). Holiday~ We pre booked Eiffel tower meal £150 i think. Really worth it, gorgeous food and champagna ;-). Girlfriend liked it, got engaged and everything. We took a bus tour...expensive but worth it to get to the most important parts. You must check out the 'latin quater'- might not be called that. We also did an evening bike tour with 'fat tyre tours' or something sounding similar. I thought I'd be gay doing cycling but it wasn't at all. Part of a group, seeing a lot of France and guided by friendly Yankee doodles. They take you on the river with complimentary wine. Overall it's really best for couples, short breaks (not a fortnight...unless your bill gates). We couldn't of have a better time. Always tell the irritating beggars to bog off. There's annoying gypsy women that winge at you and black geezers that try to sell bric-a-brack. Girlfriend paid 10 euro for a string braclet- she's not the street wisest of cats lol. Last advice..book everything with the likes of Thomas cook, France Airways etc. The shuttles ran perfect! We did not have one single hick up. Many thanks, enjoy your holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, discreet, helpful staff, room of good standard.”
Reviews.Author: holidaychum
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to the hotel from the metro at Motte Picquet Grenelle, or Dupleix.Not the prettiest street, but it was ok.We preferred it as it was quieter road. We did not get woken early by any dustcarts! Well stocked supermarket across the street, bakers on the corner. Plenty of good bistros around the corner. Easy walk to Champ des Mars, Eiffel Tower, Trocadero. Safe out and about at night. We stayed in a 5th floor, Superior room,which was spacious by Parisienne standards, with a street view. We could see the top of the Eiffel Tower from our French windows;good at night when it was lit up. Pleasant to sit and look out from room, especially, as the weather was delightful. The staff are courteous, helpful. They looked after our luggage upon early arrival and when we had a late departure, enabling us to see more attractions before we left. The mini bar/fridge is well stocked, reasonable choice on t.v., room service is available, but we did not try it. We took a travel kettle, stored milk in mini fridge. Room has phone for self set wake up service, temperature control (room was comfortably warm).Good sized, comfy bed was made everyday, towels changed regularly. Room is quite dark, as lit by lamps, but this did not bother me. Plenty of cupboard space for our clothing/luggage. Bathroom has adequate hot water for shower. Hairdryer was useful. Not so keen on the slight toilet odour- I don't think strong cleaning products are used due to environmental concerns. I did not have any trouble with the lift size, but then I did not take huge suitcases.4 average sized guests can fit in it. Sure, it is not massive, but this is an old building, so you cannot expect an industrial sized lift. The only negative point; walls are quite thin-take ear plugs if you have amorous neighbours! I spent hours checking out many hotels in Paris. Overall, I was pleased with my choice, with regards to hotel room size, location, price, service.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend...”
Reviews.Author: goteamliz
Reviews.Content: We booked this as part of a Eurostar travel and hotel package and were pleasantly surprised. Close to two metro stations (Dupleix and École Militaire) and a stones throw from the Eiffel Tower and the Seine, its in a fantastic location. The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel clean, contemporary and quiet. Breakfast wasn't included in the price and at 19 euros it seemed a little pricey, however there is a little supermarket opposite the hotel for cheap snacks. Our room, although a little on the cosy side was spotless, well decorated and comfy and came complete with flat screen TV, DVD player and mini bar. The en-suite bathroom was again, very clean and stocked with L'Occitane products. Two little minor points are that the room was a little dark (no main light, only a few lamps) and the only mirror was in the bathroom so not great for getting ready if the other person is in there, but those little moans aside, it was a fantastic hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in a Wonderful City”
Reviews.Author: ReddevilNewport
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here for 3 nights as part of our 25th Wedding Anniversary. Prior to arriving, the staff were very helpful in assisting me with the booking and the selection of the room. The hotel is located in a quiet area and there are plenty of bars and restaurants within a short distance. The Eiffel Tower is again only a 10 minute walk away. Throughout our stay the staff were helpful and friendly.The rooms are small but they are nicely furnished and have all the necessary fittings. However, the only mirror was in the bathroom so you may want to take your own if you want to do your hair! The supermarket opposite offers good value especially the wine which is very reasonable. Paris is a beautiful city and we walked everywhere as it is the best way to see the city. We also used the Metro to get to key parts of the city and it is really easy to use and very cheap. Roadside news stands sell tickets for the Metro and there is one near to Motte Pique Grennelle which is only 5 minutes from the hotel. The Eiffel Tower is a must especially at night, it is simply awesome and the views from the top are very special. the only down side is the number of people begging and the souvenir sellers at the base of the tower. Must see sights include, the tower, Arc de Triumph, Montamarte, The Louvre and Notre Dame. We also went on a river dinner cruise with Bateaux Parisiens which is situated near the Eiffel Tower. It was absolutely superb and i would highly recommend it. It took two and a half hours and the food, wine and the sites as well as the atmosphere was without fault. Paris is a wonderful and roamntic city and one which we would fully recommend and one which we will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, comfortable, quiet, don't come expecting the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: cascade0220
Reviews.Content: We arrived at night which did not give us a good idea of the area the hotel is in. It felt very deserted and isolated but next morning we realised this was not the case. It's close to the Eiffel Tower, the Metro, restaurants and cafes. We felt safe walking around at night and there is a large super market across the street which was also very convenient. The staff were helpful for the most part but we did leave on a sour note. I spoke with the man at the front desk to request a wake up call on the morning of our departure and he "forgot" about it. This created many problems for us on our last day and we missed a great part of our tour and were late to the airport as a complication. He was not apologetic, very rude, and treated us as though we were to blame for his mistake. It was very unfortanate seeing as another hotel employee was very kind and helpful earlier in our stay - but he certainly put a damper on our postivity towards the hotel in general.

Reviews.Title: “O,K hotel, stayed at better in Paris....”
Reviews.Author: lizzygrant
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris in a number of years, and our first time away from the children therefore we were really looking forward to this short break. After reading all the reviews on trip advisor about this hotel I was really excited about staying in the perfect place. Perhaps my expectation were too high and therefore when we arrived we were slightly disappointed. The hotel is only a short 5 minutes from the metro but down a rather shabby street. The hotel lobby is chic and impressive but the rooms are small and noisy. Our phone wasn't connected, the tv remote control didn't work and the heating was either too cold ( extra blankets needed) or full blast. It's location from the Eiffel tower is a plus point. The breakfast was mediocre and very disappointing, went to a cafe on the second morning instead. It was O.K- have stayed in better

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: martin1England
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! Upon first arrival it feels faily distant from the main tourist track, but once you get your bearings you realise it is an excellent location for everywhere via the metro and a very easy walk to the Eiffel Tower. Reception staff very patient even with the American guests in front of us who had about 3000 questions completely oblivious to the number of people waiting behind them!! Rooms are smallish, but very nicely decorated. Breakfast a bit expensive but a very nice bistro close by provides excellent croissant and coffee at a much better price! All in all I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great pick”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglander4
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here over Christmas of 2009. The hotel has a boutique feel and is decorated very tastefully. The staff is helpful. The rooms are nice and large for French standards. Location can't be beat. We could see the Eiffel Tower from our room and were a mere five minute walk from the landmark. Also a quick walk to Les Invalides and numerous cheese shops, restaurants, and patisseries. I would highly recommend this hotel and would happily return myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Minue
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideally located in Paris literally a few blocks from the Eiffel Tower, the Champs de mars, the batobus (a great way to see all the sights in two days - a walk on walk off water taxi that takes you to Notre Dame, the Louvre, Champs-Elysées) a walk from the Trocadéro (where you can see the Eiffel Tower light up at about 7 or 8 pm/nightfall)... the room was very clean, we had a balcony but really all we saw was the grocery store across the street. Bathroom was a decent size and very clean, bedding was very clean. It was not large but had a large screen tv and a small fridge we were able to keep our lunches for the next day in. We were so tired all we did really was sleep (a two day tour of Paris after 4 days in London) after we returned to the hotel. Metro was easily accessible (a few stops to the catacombs). LOTS of coffee shops (coffee is more expensive than an entire breakfast but it is worth it) and a McDonalds within 5 minutes walking (if you are into that). The only thing that was on and off was the internet, it was slow but the staff was quick to respond. I wish I took pictures of the hotel, I have just started travelling more often for leisure. Biggest challenge was trying to find a taxi that accepted credit (american express) at the airport. Once we found one, we hired him immediately for the ride back to the airport. It was a fairly expensive ride but definitely worth it from the hotel (about 50 Euros if I recall correctly).

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: jeniq83
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL! After only a few short hours of arriving in Paris, my father-in-law passed away at the young age of 59. We had to make other travel arrangements to come home for the visitation and funeral. To my shock and great disappointment, the manager of Hotel le Marquis charged us for the entire stay and did not refund any money for the nights that we were not able to stay. What an inconsiderate person! After dealing with the death of a loved one, this was one more additional headache that could have been easily avoided. Save your self the trouble and stay somewhere else that has friendly and caring staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful concierge, across a cheap food mart”
Reviews.Author: SheikhaNadia
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel and thought that the brisk 5 minute walk to the eiffel tower was incredibly romantic.... the fact the hotel was NOT in the middle of paris and across the eiffel helps the pocket! You are then around restaurants that are TASTY, ethnic and not extremely expensive about a few minutes walk from your hotel.... dupleix is our metro stop which is ONE away from the eiffel center but its the same distance and is much nicer to walk.. the dupleix area is also a nice way to see REAL paris and not the touristy type that surrounds the eiffel Anyways enjoy your trip and i HIGHLY recommend this hotel.. the rooms were clean... very chic and boutique-like... a little on the smaller side BUT that's most of Europe... our room overlooked a small courtyard which was very cute... I definitely recommend you save up some breakfast and go into the mart across the hotel and put some stuff into your room fridge! My husband and I saved possibly 150 euros on just eating in some of the time and then had great dinners! BTW careful with your wallets on the metro!!! ENJOY PARIS!!! you will love it!! (just keep tabs of expenditure if you are on a budget but spend, its PARIS!)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a very good location close to Eiffel.”
Reviews.Author: im_the_travel_fairy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Marquis for 4 nights in late October. We were pleasantly suprised by the opulent decor in the room. It was a very good sized room. It had a balcony overlooking the street. The concierge was very helpful in booking tickets to the Lido, although there was a fee (20 euros) included in this service. She was also helpful with directions around paris. Everyone we spoke to spoke English fluently. The bathroom had a tub and shower head and was pretty large. Our only complaint was that being on a lower floor it was pretty noisy on the weekday mornings. Trash pickup and other noises awoke us each weekday morning we were there. Weekend mornings were quiet. The hotel is about 2 or 3 blocks from the Eiffel, which is nice to see it every day, but I think next time I might opt for staying closer to the louvre and orsay. Overall though it really was a beautiful hotel in a great location though, so no complaints. They do have included wireless internet but we could not get our ipods to connect to it (java script error).

Reviews.Title: “Overated hotel - poor service and not exactly great location!”
Reviews.Author: neetLondon
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a three night stay at the Le Marquis hotel in Paris. This hotel is definetely not four star standard. A small boutique hotel, staff are very unfriendly and the breakfast is poor. There is no room service available at night. We found the hotel out of the way of most major attractions. Although it is advertised as being near the eiffel tower, it is still a fifteen minute walk. We will definetley not be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: GingerLondon
Reviews.Content: I spend a lot of time in Paris and hotels have been really hit and miss for me. But this was just a wonderful and pleasant surprise - the hotel was actually as it was described on the website if not even better!!! The location is just perfect - on a quiet street just a few minutes away from the Eiffel Tour. Close to lovely restaurants. I was there on business so I did not really get a chance to enjoy the hotel and for that I was truly disappointed. The rooms are spacious, decorated to a very high spec, with all the ameneties you would expect. They have really gone for the chic look. I plan on staying there on my next trip and dragging my husband along. The rack price is not cheap but if you search online with hotel search engines you are bound to get a good discount. I paid 50% of the usual price and so it was just the most incredible value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Above average”
Reviews.Author: snazziest
Reviews.Content: This is a good example of the modern boutique hotel. It's stylish and a little hip, while still having enough comfort to make it a practical place to stay. The supemarket across the street was a nice extra. The Erawan Thai reataurant is around the corner and VERY good. The hotel staff was low key to a fault. Don't expect anyone to ask how you are, or to anticipate your needs.

Reviews.Title: “1st Anniversery”
Reviews.Author: ceejay69
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to everyone. The rooms were really nicely decorated and cleaned every day. The location was the best - down a quiet street, and felt very safe. Theres a supermarket opposite if you want to get bread/cheese/wine for the room. We asked for a room with a balcony when we booked it and were were surprised to get one (its not the kind you can sit out on, but nice to have the windows wide open) The staff were very pleasent, and NOT rude as previous travellers said, and were helpful with directiong us to the train for Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Warning - Jacob Booking Is No Guarantee !”
Reviews.Author: drowt23
Reviews.Content: After searching for a couple of hours on the net to find a nice hotel in a good location at a sensible price I decided on Le Marquis and booked a weekend break with Directlinecitybreaks as a surprise for my wife. Everything seemed in order - everything was paid for and we had a JACOB booking reference. When we arrived at 11:00pm on the Friday evening and handed over our accomodation voucher which we'd printed off we were told there was a problem and there were no rooms - we'd be transferred to another hotel nearby (Mercure Paris Tour Eiffel Grenelle) - we were assured by the receptionist at Le Marquis that the hotel we were going to was of a similar standard. Unfortunately it was far from what we were expecting, although the location was good So be aware - arrive on a late flight and you're unlikely to get a room - booking confirmation or not !

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel in Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: Daria0000
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. We went on our honeymoon and were pleased with the service and their ability to accommodate our requests. The location is perfect, only a few blocks walking distance from the Eiffel, we even got a view of the eiffel from our room. Terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan N
Reviews.Content: Rooms very good size for Paris; good bathroom, very well appointed: Hassle free check in and out with courteous staff; Staying as I did in July I got a great deal for a 4 star hotel just 1km south west of the Eiffel Tower in a quiet residential area but with a great choice of cafes,restaurants and bars within walking distance; Personally I always find hotel breakfasts very expensive catering as they do for business people on expenses so I take a wander around the corner and get something for a lot less Jonathan Nettleton

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Joanna_Faith
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel for 3 nights while on a mini-break to Paris. We booked directly with the hotel, and got a superior room for the price of a smaller room, which was good. The room was a good size, nice and clean and remained so during our stay. Some lovely toiletrieswere provided in our bathroom. And it was air-conditioned,which was so lovely considering how warm it was during our visit. My partner was woken up by loud people one night, but this was not the fault of the hotel, and we found it very quiet. No street noise. The location was very good. Some lovely restaurants nearby and right near the Eiffel Tour if you want to be near that. 2 metro stations within easy reach also. Supermarket (large) right across the street which is very handy. also, a bank for the cycle hire scheme in Paris is on that street. A couple of points. When it was booked, they said that they would take the cost of first room then, and the rest later. However, when I checked out, they said I owed for the 3 nights. They had only taken an authorisation (which would have come off my available balance). They had not taken the money twice or anything, but I had planned to pay for 2 nights, and had to pay for 3 which was slightly unhelpful. Also, when I was trying to understand the confusion, the person working on the desk did not seem very bothered, which was not good. Also, I pointed out the fact that the seal on the bottom of the shower door was broken, and so water was leaking onto the floor. Not a problem, but again, got the feeling that he was not listening or that he cared. When asked for some advice about the local area, they were not very forthcoming, but said something like "most places should be open", although our guide book said that most places were shut on Sundays. They do provide wi-fi there and seem to indicate that it can be used in the room, once you have the code. But it did not. It only worked in the lobby. These really are minor points, but other than that, very good place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and great location”
Reviews.Author: DorsetWeekenders
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Paris before, and unless you are prepared to look at 5* my experience is that the rooms in general are quite small. However, we loved this hotel in terms of it's location, peaceful rooms and it had a cozy feel to it. The furnishings were all of good quality. The room we had was clean and fresh. The room was indeed quite small but perfectly adequate for a few nights away. Although the outlook from our window was to a back yard, not particulaly pleasant, it didn't bother us in the slightest because we wanted a peaceful night, having previously stayed in cities with a great outlook but very noisy. Location was excellent, with the Eiffel Tower and the Batobus just 15 mins walk, and the Metro 5 mins walk. A few good restaurants within walking distance, but we chose to eat in the Latin Quarter for the atmosphere. A couple of comments have been made of the staff. We found the staff were perfectly courteous although not chatty. I guess that most of their custom is from UK and USA and therefore unless they are fluent in English then why would they stike up chatty conversation?! Breakfast was perfectly fine, with scrambled eggs and sausages, and cheese and cold meat. Also the usual fruit salad and croissants etc. Coffee was excellent, and made fresh each time. All very nice and all served on Villeroy and Bosch china. We would definately recommend this hotel and would return ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “dated, unfriendly, NOT up to 4* standards, bad value for money”
Reviews.Author: Vivid_gb
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small friendly hotel on the left bank when I fell for the nice reviews of Le Marquis which are dominant on this site. We spent 2 nights in it and are confused as to what on earth one can like about this hotel??? The room was small and badly decorated: gloom brown interior, dark red ceiling in the bathroom – yak. The bathroom equipment was dated, malfunctioning and not cleaned up to claimed 4 * standards. The level of noise was high: we could hear people parting in the room across the hallway at 3 a.m so clearly that we had to complain to the reception about it, the second source of noise was a dated air conditioning system that produced a very annoying burping sound every second minute. Friendliness is not the word I would use about the hotel personnel: not a single “bonjour”, not a single smile. Food in the hotel was overpriced as it was fairly noted in other reviews. Overall the hotel was a disappointment: It does NOT live to 4* standards and is NOT a cleaver choice for money.

Reviews.Title: “Better than most, but not brilliant...”
Reviews.Author: daburger
Reviews.Content: I stay overnight regularly in Paris on business and stayed here on three seperate occasions during May 2009. On two occasions I stayed in the same room on the 3rd floor facing the main road (quiet but cobbled which is noisy at 5am when the rubbish lorry arrives) and although small was clean and comfortable. On the third occasion I stayed on the 5th floor which wasn't as pleasant - facing the courtyard with water damaged bath panels and noisy air-con. When I enquired about the latter I was told it was a hotel wide issue - I had to personally turn the water inlet to the aircon off in the ceiling void to stop the noise, simply enough but was seemingly just fobbed off by the receptionist. On this occasion I also had to wait for the guy on reception to return from dropping his car off at the local garage before I could check-out...no big issue as this is Paris and c'est la vie!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: MortB
Reviews.Content: The hotel Le Marquis is relatively new on the Parisian hotel scene, and it deserves to be better known. It is one of two hotels belonging to the Inwood group, and the exterior appearance belies the comfort of the interior. This hotel is an older building which has been completely remodeled and redecorated to meet the highest standards for comfort. The rooms are spacious, and are decorated in a contemporary style which I found to be very pleasant. The service is excellent, with English spoken by virtually all the staff, even the chamber maids (this for Paris is truly exceptional). On the ground level there is a small bar which also serves breakfast (not included in the room rate. but not excessively expensive by comparison with the prices in nearby cafes). There is also a lounge with comfortable chairs and even English-language newspapers. The hotel is situated just next to the Village Suisse, an antiques center well-known in Paris, and about a 5-minute walk from two metro lines and two bus lines. It is also about a 10-minute walk from UNESCO, the United Nations Educational Scientific and Cultural Organization. The rue Dupleix is a quiet side street, and consequently, even the rooms on the street side of the hotel are quiet at night. There is a supermarket just across the street where one can find fruits, beverages and snack items without having to deal (in French) with the local merchants. I found the service at this hotel to be excellent. Phone messages were taken and delivered under the door of my room, and little requests, such as having the room made up early in the day, were satisfied with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, great rooms, great staff, will be back!”
Reviews.Author: vreverdy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Le Marquis with my wife and kids in February and I must say that we were more than pleased with our stay. The hotel is ideally located close to the Eiffel tower, the staff is courteous and the rooms offer great amenities. We booked 2 rooms, one had a great view on the Eiffel tower and the other a very cute balcony. I would definitely recommend this hotel as have stayed in many hotels in Paris, and the value of this one is incontestable.

Reviews.Title: “When I pay for a four Stars I would at least like to be said "Hello"”
Reviews.Author: JohnEntwistle
Reviews.Content: The hotel could be really a peaceful and relaxing tool for a Eiffel holiday in Paris. Unfortunately the personnel has always been unfair, bored and NON educated with us. No one was standind at the reception desk the most of the time and we never received a single "hello" every morning when we pass by the desk. Breakfast offered expensive and not fitting a four stars. Service medium. The cups for tea should be cleaned before used by Customers. Pity.

Reviews.Title: “Would have loved the Hotel, had they not double booked my room!!”
Reviews.Author: Rob056
Reviews.Content: I decided to take my Girlfriend away for her birthday to this Hotel in the hope that my search for a great Hotel would come true. When we attempted to check in I was told that they had double booked my room for my 2 night stay and were transfering me to another Hotel in Paris! To say i was not happy is an understatement. The Hotel we transfered to was below the standard i expected and not what i planned for my weekend break. We did get a free glass of Orange juice whilst we waited for our transfer to the other Hotel. Don't think i will spend a few hours looking for the perfect Hotel again if this is all i get when i arrive!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: vegetarian-girl
Reviews.Content: stayed 4 nights with husband and enjoyed an upgraded room on 5th floor with partial view of eiffel and a pretty balcony. room was well-sized and well-decorated. quiet with great location to sites, metro, and i agree with those who wrote before me, a great pastry shop and a grocery store just a few steps away. only suggestion: there could have been free internet in the lobby. (note: free wifi in room with LAN). but overall, staff was helpful. we were very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfect”
Reviews.Author: travelboo22
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely! It was in the perfect location (less than five minutes walk to the eiffel tower) and was on a quiet street. The room was small but there was pleanty of storage space. The room was decorated beautifully and although there was no view we were happy for the silence so we could get a good nights sleept after a day of walking round paris. The bathroom was nice and the toiletries were gorgeous! I would definately stay here again. All the staff were extreamly helpful and the whole hotel was gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris, Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelfan05
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to go to Paris, but in regards to the hotel I had no expectations. So it came to a surprise that the hotel and its surroundings were perfect for me. Yes, it’s true, it’s a very quiet hotel and the rooms very compact, but at the same time I was glad that this hotel was very quiet and so was the feel good neighbourhood. I felt safe and was not awoken by annoying traffic noises or drunks. One late evening I walked from the Eiffel tower back to the hotel (5-10min walk) and even it was dark and the park not particularly busy, I experienced no problems and actually felt safe walking back to the hotel in this area. For dining, café or just snacks there are plenty of restaurants and coffee shops on the main road near the Metro station La Motte Picquet Grehelle (which u might use a lot and its just 3-5min from the hotel), but to be honest there are so many other places you can eat out (eg St Germain des Pres), pick one……. Also, I had a very relaxing time in my room, which was clean and cosy at all times and I used the mornings to sleep in and charge energy for the afternoons and evenings of sightseeing. The hotel is very stylish and the rooms themselves have a very calming atmosphere. The hotel personnel were very friendly and helpful from the beginning in all matters of inquiries. They also spoke English and made you feel very welcome. All in all, I can definitely recommend this hotel to anybody who goes to Paris to enjoy a romantic get away, business trip or just for fun. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this little gem Le Marquis”
Reviews.Author: LizmacLondon
Reviews.Content: Our room was gorgeous with a sort of modern chic and elegance and looking out the window we had a view of the top of the eiffel tower at night lit up and twinkling. The staff were just fabulous, the décor beautiful, the bedrooms just lovely and the location was just marvellous, with the Eiffel tower just around the corner. This bijou boutique hotel I feel really is a true gem in the heart of Paris. Without a doubt my favourite parisian hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SJBFMA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Marquis for a week in September 2008. Our room was on the small side - a nice sized bed, but not much spare space in the room even though the only bits of furniture were a small desk, a TV unit and a couple of chairs. The views were of the street - not exactly classic Paris views, but good honest reflection of life just off the main tourist streets. We didn't eat in the hotel, and only saw a handful of people taking breakfast there. The supermarket opposite the hotel has a good range of stuff, and the bakery a couple of doors along from the hotel did great pain au chocolat. The main reason for giving 4 stars is the location - turn left out of the hotel and you are 5 minutes walk from the Metro, turn right and you are five minutes from the Eiffel Tower. All of Paris is therefore close at hand, yet the setting of the hotel is relaxed and feels secluded. The hotel has been done out recently, and is nicely presented. Its not cheap, but the location is worth paying for.

Reviews.Title: “Le Marquis okay but too many problems”
Reviews.Author: SpikeVancouver
Reviews.Content: As noted by others who have stayed at this hotel, the location is terrific. We walked to the Eiffel Tower and all the major art galleries and gardens. However, we had a room on the street and although it is in a residential area, there is a grocery store across the street which is convenient but noisy early in the morning. Two issues with our stay - the room even though we were in a deluxe room, was incredibly small, much smaller than we expected, with very little storage space which was a problem as we were there for a full week. Secondly, although the staff was generally polite and tried to be helpful, they are not particularly knowledgeable about the local area and were completely unhelpful when it came to room amenities - we ran out of soap and although we asked for soap three times, we were finally told that the person who does the ordering, forgot to order soap! Evenutally, after some rather strong words, they agreed to go out and buy us a bar of soap! Sounds like a little thing but when you are paying almost 300 euros a night, we thought soap ought to be included! There were a few other little things that you kind of expect from a hotel of that price - a full length mirror; an alarm clock - both would have been helpful. L, Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Relaxed58
Reviews.Content: Thankyou to all the Staff who helped make this excursion my 10th Wedding Anniversary, a trip that my wife and I will never forget. Their suggestion and help in booking our anniversary meal on the 56th floor of the Tower Montaparnasse, the restaurant Le Ciel de Paris was fantastic. Thanks again, beautifull Hotel, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Le Marquis!”
Reviews.Author: D&DMatthews
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 10th wedding anniversary for 3 nights at the beginning of August. We had read the reviews on trip advisor and that helped us to make our decision. What a good decision it turned out to be! A great hotel very close to the Eiffel Tower, probably a five minute walk away. The hotel was extremely clean and tidy and the staff were friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel was fantastic. Just five minutes from the metro in one direction and five minutes from the Eiffel Tower in the other. As many other people have mentioned before, the bakery on the corner and the supermarket opposite come in very handy! Just what you need on a city break. All in all, a great stay in Paris, thanks to Le Marquis. We have already recommended this hotel to some of our friends who booked and are enjoying their stay as we speak! Would definitely return! Enjoy x

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fabulous Location, Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: CME_UK
Reviews.Content: After much hunting around for a central hotel that was reasonably priced in Paris yet offered a good level of facilities/service, we stumbled across the 4 star Le Marquis - they offered us a good rate for our stay which was reasonable for the centre of Paris and having looked at about 20 hotels before it was excellent value for money! The hotel is in a central, yet quiet district of Paris right by the Effel Tower - offering a modern, contemporary styling combined with an artistic touch. It is fair to say the central location of the hotel is perfect for sight seeing tours of most of the Paris tourist spots as well as going further afield to Versailles or Disneyland. The hotel is literally 3 minutes walk from the foot of the Eiffel Tower and only a couple of minutes from a main Metro interchange station. Best place to explore for evening meals are down Rue Suffran towards the Metro station (Motte) away from the hotel as the prices increase as you got towards the Eiffel Tower... There is a very useful mini-mart supermarket opposite the hotel to stock up with provisions and drinks if you need to. We stayed at Le Marquis for 5 nights and enjoyed them all although to be fair it was very hot during our stay (37 degrees!) and we couldn't master the airconditionning which was probably on overdrive! We stayed in Room 303 with a Child's Z-bed which was all made up and waiting for us. The room was a good size even with the z-bed, with a very smart Loewe LCD TV, Minibar, generous storage and nice lighting. A great shower was on offer to wash away the city grime and a nice collection of L'Occittane toilettries. Good continental breakfasts on offer with a small selection of eggs/sausage available. Great for a quick snack before dashing out. Small bar for the evenings and a small but pleasant terrace outside. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and whenever in Paris hope we are able to grab a nice room and a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 3 night stay”
Reviews.Author: jaspySydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and loved it, we loved Paris in fact. We took so many photos of the eiffel tower since we saw it so many times with the hotel being so close. The staff were quite young and very helpful and friendly. Our baby made friends with the breakfast waitress, although we only had breakfast there once since we thought it was cheaper and nicer out in the cafes. The room was really nice and bathroom good, they included bath robes which was a treat. They added another breakfast on our bill but when we said it was incorrect there was no issue. Overall enjoyed our stay alot.

Reviews.Title: “Hated Le Marquis on Rue Dupleix (Paris France)”
Reviews.Author: ManinSuitcase
Reviews.Content: I hate being the guy who has a negative review, but I have to tell you that this Hotel is horrible. The only thing that it has going for it is the location near the Eiffel Towel. The rooms are spartan, there is no internet connection, and good luck trying to work the remote controls on the TV. The service/staff was less than accomodating. And when they tried to accomadate they did so with a bad attitude and with equipment that was sub-par. Maybe I was in a bad mood or something but this is not a place I recommend for any business or casual traveler. I give this place a zero. I got the sense that it was the kind of place where you bring a lady of the night and then do the walk of shame the next day. Definitely not worth the money. Sorry..but I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Le Marquis”
Reviews.Author: melissarose88
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my boyfriend for one night in November 2007. We booked through the Eurostar website and we got a great deal, considering the price per night at this hotel is 315 Euros a night on their website. We booked a superior room and it was a fairly decent size. The room was modern and very clean, as was the bathroom. The bedding was amazing! The bed was huge, I move a lot in the night and I didn't even touch my boyfriend at all! The duvet and the blankets were so fluffly and soft, they were so substantial they weighed you down under them, in a good way! The shower was hot and the pressue was good, but because of the shower design there you had to be careful not to get water everywhere. There is a cute little bar in the lobby and a library where you can just sit and relax. The lobby and common areas all are very well kept, clean and modern. The location was great, very close to the Eiffel Tower and a lot of other attractions. There is a grocery store across the street which is good for cheap wine and snacks! (It smells weird in most Paris grocery stores, so we didn't buy anything but chips and stuff). All in all, I would definitely stay here again. It was a beautiful hotel in a great location, and you cannot beat the beds! It did not disappoint, and it stood up to it's 4/5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk staff are very rude”
Reviews.Author: almatraveller
Reviews.Content: Someone forgot to mention to the employees of this hotel that they are in the "Hospitality Business" The concierge treat you as if you are a nusance, especially if there is a mistake concerning your bill that needs clarification. They are not above insulting you personally, and insulting the country you come from. I would never recommend staying at this hotel based on the terrible treatment we received.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Juliette22
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a long weekend, May 24-28th and loved it! After looking at hotels in Paris for nearly 4 hours on the internet, I booked it after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor, and due to the good price I got online. It was better than I anticipated. The rooms are very comfortable, good sized with free internet access and flat screen tv. We didn't spend a ton of time in the room, but when we did, we were always glad to get 'home' and relax. The staff was extremely nice, kind and helpful. A couple of times we sat at the bar and had a glass of wine in the very comfortable lounge. This hotel is small, clean, very convenient and central to the center of Paris... it's not the Ritz, but it was just perfect for us, and clean, clean, clean. Two great bistro's are just around the corner, a bakery is just next door, and a supermarket is across the street if you forgot to pack toothpaste, socks, or razors, or if you want to buy some wine or cheese to have back in your room. It rained on and off while we were there and the always ready free umbrellas in the lobby were great. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doo7
Reviews.Content: I recently spent two nights at the Le Marquis in Paris and found the hotel to be extremely comfortable and perfectly located with a metro stop at the end of the road and the Eiffel Tower about 5 minutes walk away. The street is quiet (fairly residential) and has some lovely quaint little shops nearby. The hotel rooms are not huge but bigger than the Paris average and beautifully decorated. The bathrooms are great and the water pressure in the shower was excellent (not always something that you get in Europe). The hotel breakfast was simple but tasty and there were plenty of choices. All the staff spoke English and were more than willing to offer directions and advice on what to see in Paris. I work in travel and would definitately reccommend this hotel to colleagues and customers.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: Rachael_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Lemarquis for Easter 2008. The hotel is clean and is furnished modernly. It also has a great location near the Eiffel Tour and various metro links. The breakfast was nice. Requests for items like extra pillows were quickly delivered. It should have been a GREAT hotel but someone it wasn't - it just felt very impersonal (and I appreciate for some people this may be more of a positive than a negative). This impression arises from the reception / Concierge who the whole time we were there gave the impression they were totally bored with having to deal with guests. They'd barely even bother to look up from their desk when we walked through reception. Other than that though it was a good hotel and we enjoyed our stay in Paris. If it hadn't been for the total apathy from the front desk I would have given a higher rating for Lemarquis.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet, central little hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: paaluz
Reviews.Content: This small cosy hotel is a nice contribution to the classic Paris mainstay of hotels. With just under 40 rooms, it is small and so are the rooms. However, they do not feel small and the delicate touches bring about a very classy feel to the hotel. Once inside, the room we stayed in (103) was very very quiet. Only the seldom moped outside broke the silence and we could not hear the neighbours at all. Slight noise from the hallway, barely noticeable.A clean bathroom with good amenities and shampoo / soap / conditioner from L'Occidante is always appreciated. A well stocked minibar was tempting, and not too expensive. However, the Atac grocery store across the street will lure you in with cheap, excellent French cheeses, wines, snacks and crackers. Perfect for a self-indulgent night in the room. We never got around to trying out the breakfast restaurant, since the location tempts with many good brasseries and bistros. And how can miss the baker on the corner of the block? The staff was very courteous and informative. They went above and beyond in trying to help us, and gave a very personal feeling right from the start at the sit-down reception. When did e.g. didn't know a certain drink, they were eager to learn and talk about it, without being intrusive. We booked a tour with Paris Trips at the reception and everything was quickly and securely arranged. Located at 15 Rue Dupleix [Pronounced roo dooplayicks], is is very close to the Dupleix metro on the #6 metro line. Since the 6 line intersects with the RER local train from both CDG and Orly, the hotel is easier accessed via public transport than by taxi. We drove a taxi from the RER stop in the city, and the driver got lost. The hotel is situated in a quiet, nice neighbourhood with eclectic architecture. The Eiffel tower is five minutes by foot away, a nice evening trip. Only one slight negative thing comes to mind, the plug in the bathroom did not work correct. We had to fish it out and put it aside, but it was really no problem. We alerted the staff upon checkout, they asked why we hadn't complained but we told them it was no big deal. It was noted to fix it later that day. Also, the TV lacked some standard channels, and was flaky with the dual track English dubbing. The courtesy lending out of free DVDs at the reception outweighed this by far. And who watches CNBC anyway?

Reviews.Title: “March in Paris”
Reviews.Author: samiam1959
Reviews.Content: A superior hotel. Clean and attractively furnished, with great small touches, including new flat screen TVs. A solicitous staff, personable and committed. The lobby and drawing room are elegant and understated. Safe neighborhood, with shopping, restaurants, and metro stops within easy walking distance. And all within sight of the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Option!”
Reviews.Author: NapsRJ
Reviews.Content: I've been to Le Marquis for one night this month, as part of a business trip. I have stayed in Paris other times and found this location to be very charming. It is really close to the Tower and not really full of stores around, but a little bit more residencial. There are 2 metro stations close to the hotel and a supermarket just crossing the street. The room is quite big for Paris standards, very clean and with new and modern furniture. The bathroom was equally good, with complementary small L'Occitane products. Complementary internet is available and the front desk staff is very helpful. The price is higher than I am usually willing to pay, but if your budget allows I would certainly book this hotel. Highly recommentded and no lowlights to mention at all.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: mzmlc
Reviews.Content: Boutique in every way! Yes, the bathroom had L'Occitane amenities (for women that care about the finer details), the decor simple but elegant. I was in room 402 right near the elevator which I thought would bother me but didn't. From my window I could see the very tip of the Eiffel. I loved the location - within less than 5 minutes of walking, I was enjoying the breathtaking view of the Eiffel Tower. Right across the street was a grocery market which was so convenient for snacks, water and a band-aid which I desperately needed. Also, within the block were delicious pastries for breakfast. I had meetings at the UNESCO building so it was so convenient to walk there - less than 10 minutes. I later found out that the State Dept puts up a lot of their visitors in this hotel. Concierge was helpful and attentive. Overall, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: MMandG
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marquis in November for my birthday with my partner. Magnificent rooms for the price. Large and tastefully decorated. Stunning bathroom and excellent standard of cleanliness. Situated in a quiet residential area it is perfectly located for the Eiffel Tower and River Cruises (very romantic). Metro just a short walk away. The staff were excellent and went out of their way to help us organise a tour of Paris. Breakfast was nice but there are plenty of excellent bakeries close by for coffee and croissant if you want to save some money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kitty1709
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Le Marquis 23-26 January. Very nice little hotel, spotless rooms and public areas. Staff were very helpful, will help you with any information you want, booking taxis etc. The location isn't top but it is very easy once you get to the metro station to get around. It is situated in between two metros but there are various entrances you can use and you get used to this and becomes very easy. It is about 10-15 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. There are some very nice restaurants a couple of minutes walk away, we went to L'Esquisse and was very nice, top service and nice food. The only down side I would say is on breakfast, I don't feel it was worth the extra money we paid on top of the room price, but there are a few places very close that service hot breakfasts and there is an excellent patisserie two doors down and a supermarket opposite. Overall very nice stay and would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel by far in Paris I ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Minoue-Sisteron
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel in one of last min site. We did not expect such a beautiful hotel with that price, but this hotel is by far the best hotel I ever stayed in Paris. (By the way, we stayed at least 10 hotels in Paris, not only budget hotels) Only negative point I can find may be the location. As you can find, it's 5-10 min walk from La Tour Eiffel and a few min walk from nearest station. Obviously, it's not in Opera/La louvre area, and therefore not exciting place to shop. However, if you don't mind short train ride and prefer quiet elegant neighbor, its location is actually an advantage for some people. One of many things my wife appreciated in this hotel was that they use L'occitane products in the bathroom. No lie on trip advisor ranking!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rhino11
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there for a weekend, 3 nights, good location to the rear of the Eiffel Tower, rooms small but excellent decor & clean, staff helpful & freindly. Room has a Mini bar and hotel has a limited menu. Many good local restaurants & cafes for all tastes, plenty of Taxi's, buses & river boats to see all the sights next to the Tower. Would 100% stay here again for a short break, any longer and a larger hotel with more facilities would be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Poor, I was so disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Irishgalabroad
Reviews.Content: My husband booked 5 nights at Le Marquis as a treat and as always he checked it up on Tripadvisor. The ratings were very good but I have to say that at 300euro a night it was not worth the money. Our room was supposed to be a Deluxe double (403) but I still fail to see what made the room deluxe. It was a very small and very basic room with the smallest ensuite I have ever seen. I cannot understand why it is a 4 star hotel! The staff never acknowledged us when we passed and no effort was made to help me with my bags even though I was 25 weeks pregnant. I certainly would not return to this hotel. However, this is a beautiful area of paris and the Bakers on the corner is not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: SunBronzed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights after arriving on the Metro from the Eurostar. It was abit of a walk from the Metro to the hotel but if you're of a happy nature it shouldn't spoil anything!
