Its also was in a residential area so was quiet with a nice square and park just 1 minute away. The hotel is charming and small but perfectly formed. We had a room facing the street so got lots of light and could even see the top of the Eiffel Tower which gave us a thrill. The bed was lovely and comfy and the overall decor modern and chic. Our room has a sloping wall which could have made it seem small but it was fine. There was plenty of closet space and even though the bathroom was tiny it had everything you could need from one. Breaklfast was continental and I guess we were too lazy (sore feet more like) to walk to the nearby cafes instead. It is a small space so minimal conversation as everyone was practically sharing a table but that's the french way! There is a sister hotel about 10mins walk away which we'll probably check out next time, but this hotel was great for a few nights. It's ideally located for the tourist spots and the river but more of a long leisurely walk to Notre Dame area and I think its quite a hidden gem and popular with decerning travellers young and old.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: kimey
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay in this small but smart hotel. The location is great for accessing the Eiffel tower especially at night on our way home from a meal and drinks. Rooms were compact but very comfortable and clean, staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: melsatchfield
Reviews.Content: After a long walk in the rain with heavy suitcases due to repairs on the 6 train, and a confused bus ride, we finally made it to Le Marquis where we found a very helpful,appeasing staff, a clean, nicely decorated room, and a warm dry resting place. This is a very nice little hotel and my boyfriend and I were very impressed with their energy-saver tactics. The breakfast isn't included in the price of the room, but it is worth it compared to the prices, service and quality you might get at one of the touristy restaurants nearby. There is someone at the front desk 24 hours and they are friendly and accomodating. I really loved this hotel and I would definately recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel”
Reviews.Author: CheshireMonkey44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. It is in an excellent location for visiting the Eiffel Tower (two roads away). There are restaurants and cafes within 5 minutes walk and the area seemed quite safe. If you arrive by car from the north using Navman then beware - it will take your round the infamous Arc de Triomphe roundabout, which was an experience in itself. The hotel is quite small but prettily decorated with a nice atmosphere - I especially liked the pale pink drapes in the foyer. We had a classic room, which was nice but rather dark due to both the decor and interior lighting and the fact that it looked out onto the back courtyard and so didn't get much natural light. We got a glance at a slightly bigger room from the corridor which we assumed was a superior classic and this seemed a better size and overlooked the street so it got more light. The bathroom had small Occitane products in it, which smelled lovely. The staff were all very friendly, despite it being quite busy when we arrived. We made use of the underground garage, which is part of the small supermarket garage across the street and is 15 euro a day. If you arrive on a sunday when the supermarket is closed they give you an access card - but beware the lights in there don't stay on long!! The breakfast room is quite small and at first there does not appear to be much, but all the usual stuff such as cheeses, meats, eggs, croissants, cereal, yogurt, coffee, juice and fruit, were there dotted about the room. Having said this it was expensive for what it was and cheaper to go to a nearby cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and intimate”
Reviews.Author: MarabellaStockholm
Reviews.Content: We spent three wonderful days in Paris, thus two nights at the Hotel le Marquis. The hotel is situated within walking distance of many attractions in the central part of Paris. Our room was small, but very comfortable and clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful, both when we arrived and during our stay. We will definitely return both to Paris and to the hotel in the future,

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy!!”
Reviews.Author: pinotnoirStockport
Reviews.Content: My first stay in Paris and selected this hotel using this site.I would agree with the general reviews of this hotel its modern,well run and in my opinion in a fantastic position 5 minute walk to the Eiffel tower,5 minutes to nearest Metro.I booked the superior room and although it was compact it was more than adequate for my 4 day stay.The staff were professional and courteous.The check in and out very quick.I would definitely recommend this hotel for your stay.I booked a couple of meals at Restaraunts using reviews on this site and was dissapointed with L`Esquisse around the corner from the hotel,the steak was tough as old boots and as it was apparent when the waitress took away my plate with virtually the whole steak still there and I explained why I couldnt eat it, no apology was forthcoming,I tried Bistro Suffren across the road which was far better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Ozgreg66
Reviews.Content: On my first trip to Paris, I chose to stay at this beautiful boutique hotel. The location is fantastic, just a couple of blocks from the Champ de Mar and the Eiffel Tower. The staff were welcoming, extremely friendly, and spoke good English. The room was delightful, immaculately presented, beautifully furnished and well appointed, including a mini-bar. The hotel's continental breakfast was great, and there are a host of cafés and brasseries within very easy walking distance. There is also a supermarket directly across the road. In short, this hotel was a wonderful introduction to Paris for me. I would recommend it very highly. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Met my expectations has room to grow!”
Reviews.Author: mariobono
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 rooms for 4 nights at this hotel. All single Deluxe rooms. I considered it a fairly good price considering a holiday in Paris landed on Tuesday May 1st, 2007. For my first night (Saturday April 28th, 2007) I was charged more for the rooms then the other 3 nights. First night I was charged 250 Euro (about 340 USD), and the other two 225 Euro (about 306 USD). The other 3 nights I was charged 150 Euro (about 204 USD) for one and 130 Euro (about 177 USD) for the other two. The grand total was 1,935 Euro (about 2,635 USD). Positives: A lady at the front desk at check-in made sure I had reservations taken care of and everything was fine going forward with my stay in Paris. The same front desk person made all my reservations that I asked for and then some. She was tremendously helpful on all accounts of making sure I got things reserved that I wanted reserved and even suggested other places to dine or take into account. Front desk staff was very helpful calling for taxes if need to be picked up at the hotel. With only 35 rooms it feels more like an apartment then a hotel. Very personal touch to the hotel which you don’t get at the bigger named hotels. Good size bed and overall felt pretty comfortable. The bath soaps and creams and what not were the brand L'Occitane which I thought was a nice touch. Room was cleaned everyday. Overall very clean looking hotel. Newspapers down in the small but quant lobby Grocery store right across the street for snacks and water needs. Negatives: Small bathroom took some use to getting use too. One elevator shared by all so some delay time some of the time getting from floor to floor. The location is great for the Eifel Tower (walking distance) but it is on a one-way road and in a weird position so taxis find it really hard to drop you off. But for some reason they find it to pick you up just fine so go figure. (Note on taxes. I traveled with four people so in Paris they charge for an extra person and also when you call for a taxi in Paris the time it takes them to get to you to pick you up they charge you for. Also taxis hate picking up four people. So this hotel is in a weird position so sometimes the charge is already at 6 to 8 euro before you get in it. My suggestion is take a stroll down to the street and hail a taxi unless you don’t care about 6 to 8 euros). Charge for breakfast. Charge for internet use.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: JRD90
Reviews.Content: Hotel has great location, very close to metro and Eiffel Tower. Staff extremely helpful. Rooms comfortable. Website is helpful, rooms are exactly as pictured. If looking for a place more "happening" at night, look around Marais or St. Germain. Not a lot of rest or bars in the hotel area.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of extra charges”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid_Traveler_2
Reviews.Content: Perfectly nice hotel, but we were charged an extra 125 euro per night for a nine-year-old.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: TravelsEurope
Reviews.Content: This lovely boutique style hotel is conveniently located just 8 blocks from the Eiffel Tower and offers the ambience of it's Parisian neighborhood. A wealth of outstanding restaurants and shopping within easy access to the metro means you are only minutes from all Paris landmarks and attractions. The guest rooms are very spacious and well decorated offering comfort with modern conveniences. The staff is gracious and so helpful offering a warm reception. A true treasure providing you with a very Parisian experience. Don't miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: europetrip07
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my husband to Paris for vacation and enjoyed staying at Le Marquis. For our first trip to Paris and neither of us speaking a word of French, we found the staff to be very helpful in recommending restaurants and answering all of our questions. Rooms were small but well furnished. We stayed in a superior delux room that had a small balcony overlooking the street. Very clean and bathroom was in great shape. Heard horror stories of hotels in Europe and was nervous about booking this non chain "boutique" hotel, but Le Marquis exceeded my expectations. One night we borrowed a DVD from the hotel lobby as all of the rooms have dvd players. We walked around Paris most of the time, but to get to certain things we took the metro. Get the five or three day pass, it is cheaper. Grocery store across the street is great to get things for breakfast or snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AngeleAnnecy
Reviews.Content: I just return from a business trip in Paris. I stay 3 nights at the hotel Le Marquis and everythings was perfect : very good located (10 min walk from the Eiffel Tour, 15 min by bus from Champs Elysées), very good staff (very helpfull), and fantastic decoration. Small hotel very good for tourism and for business trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Very Best”
Reviews.Author: Andi100
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at this lovely hotel, for my 40th Birthday and it could not have been better. I stayed in an amazing Deluxe room which was very well decorated, and very clean. All the staff I came across were wonderful and very helpful. The hotel is located about a 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower on a quite street, and the metro is even closer. We managed to fit in all of the sights of Paris by just jumping on the Metro. You can get a 3 day pass for about 18 euros. On the Friday evening we ate at the Suffren bistro just around the corner, and had a smashing meal with great service. For Saturday the hotel suggested we go to L'Esquisse again just around the corner and I have to stay it has to be the very best meal I have every had, my main course was nearly cold by the time I finished as I did not want it to end, agin the staff were great. There is nothing bad I could say about the hotel it was truly wonderful and all the help they gave us was the icing on the cake. Go on give your self a treat and stay at this amazing hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Margouille
Reviews.Content: Booked our stay via otel[--] for a great rate (122Euros inc. breakfast). The rooms were nice and spacious. The staff was very friendly and efficient. The location is great as it is a short stroll to the Eiffel tower. There are 2 metro stations nearby making it easy to get to most areas in Paris, you can also catch the bateaubus on the Seine. It took us 10 minutes to get to the St Michel area, 10 minutes to Charles De Gaulle/Etoile. Would definitely stay again as the last hotel we stayed at in Paris was very old and not half as pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: BetM1
Reviews.Content: Booked throught Hotwire(--) so I was quite wary on what I'll find. Was pleasantly surprised to find very clean, well-apointed, modern (I would take this anytime over 'chic' boutique hotels with old/peeling wallpapers), HUGE bathroom (for Paris standards). Bathrobe, ameniies, even a clothes dryer in the bathroom, and a new tub that you will not hesitate to take baths in! Staff (especially Alecia) is very helpful, friendly, and warm. A little out of the way to the heart of the action but a metro stop is nearby. Supermarket, bakery, restaurants, and a park with stunning Eiffel Tower view is just around the corner. Will not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but expensive!”
Reviews.Author: noakes
Reviews.Content: Was upgraded to a deluxe and managed to get free breakfast as there was a mix up at The Walt Hotel, and they moved us in here. Im glad i wasnt paying extra for the deluxe as i would have hated to have seen the standard room. Dont get me wrong our room was ok, it was clean and and modern, yet small and nothing in it to suggest why it was a deluxe! Im also glad i did not pay for the breakfast, as it was rather expensive for a small croissant and a bowl of cereal! Would i recommend this place? not really, im sure that in one of the most romantic cities in the world you can do alot better! having said that you could do alot worse too :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Very Modern”
Reviews.Author: Patrick055
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights in "Le Marquis" and had a very nice stay. It's a clean, modern, well-situated hotel with excellent and helpful staff. We asked for restaurant recommendations several times and they came up trumps for us. The rooms are quite small, but this is common in Paris apparently. The rooms are not as "boudoir-like" as the hotel would like you to believe. We were staying in room 304 and it looked like any hotel room in Paris (with 2 furry cushions!) The photos on their website are a little misleading. It's actually more modern than you might like. There's a very well-stocked supermarket across the road, selling (among other things) excellent and reasonably-priced champagne (Taittinger 23euro, Laurent-Perrier 26euro). An excuse to drink more I think! There's also a wonderful boulangerie next door to the hotel. Pick up your pain-au-chocolat and eat it in the nearby park under the Eiffel Tower. Wonderful! Nearby restaurants worth visting are Pere Claude (try the creme brulee) and Le Suffren. I would not hesitate to stay in this hotel again. Be wary of cab drivers though. The front desk in the hotel told us 50-60 euro for a taxi to the airport. It actually cost of 64 euro, incredible. We queried the fact that the taxi driver already had his meter running when we got in the car. This would have been so bad if he had not used the hotel's toilet facilites while we waited in reception and our meter was running outside. We were stunned, but didn't want to cause an argument as were running short on time. The taxi driver explained that because the hotel booked the taxi by phone that morning, the passenger must pay for the cost of the driver getting to the hotel. An opportunity for ripping people off if you ask me, it was already on 10 euros by the time we got in the back seat. (If the hotel is reading this, and the driver was doing anything untoward, the taxi number was 789) If you can, take the train to the airport and save yourself a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “We fell in Love!”
Reviews.Author: retropeel
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend to Paris for the New Year and booked the Marquis as part of a Eurostar package after looking at several hotel options. To say we were impressed by the Marquis would be an understatement - everything about it oozed charm. The intimate boutique decor and stylish choice of furnishings create a romantic ambience that you'll fall in love with. Bedrooms are adequate in size, as one would expect of a hotel of this nature, but attention to detail turn it into a very special space. The bathroom also shares this level of detailing. Coupled to the hotel itself are the friendly, approachable staff who help make your stay a memorable one. An example of this was the assistance I received New Years day in booking a restaurant - the duty manager recommended several establishments and phoned through to some that were fully booked before finding a table at the 'Sourie de Saigon' which proved to be a stunning choice! An absolutely wonderful stay and we can't wait to go back in the summer! Lee & Chrissy xxx

Reviews.Title: “A nice little gem!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Located in a largely residential area, this great little hotel is on Rue Dupleix, approximately 10 mins from the Eiffel Tower and right around the corner from some of the best restaurants and bakeries in Paris. The room was large for a Parisian hotel, and elegantly decorated with a grand bathroom(really)! Our 2nd (3rd by American standards) floor room faced the courtyard and we had to peek out and up the window to see the sky. I don't think any of the rooms faced the Eiffel Tower. But if craning your neck to glimse at the sky is not a problem for you (afterall, with so much to do, you are not there to look at the sky!!), the room was just perfect. The service was impeccable (we were there for 4 days) and the staff eager to assist us. The young staff spoke English fluently and humored us through my super-broken French. Stay there for the great service, nice rooms, grand bathrooms and proximity to the Eiffel Tower. However, if you are looking for something less modern/contemporary, more French Country or for something that offers views of the Eiffel Tower or Paris this may not be for you. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Sparkywilde
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from a 2 night stay at the Marquis. We loved the hotel for the following reasons:- - Small boutique hotel - Secure parking just across the road for £10 per night (a definate bonus in Paris!) - Very clean and modern, beautiful decor and sumptious bed linen (very nice pillows!!) - Very Very quiet and in a great location just around the corner from the Eiffel Tower Our room was a superior room but was still quite small however we were really pleased with it (401). It was so quiet (we did have a room on the back of the hotel but it would still be quiet on the front) There was a little seating area and a dressing table plus a wardrobe but no drawers. The bathroom was compact but again everything was so new and clean that it didn't matter - the toiletries are fab! You even get robes and slippers - just remember to ask for them and they send them right up. We loved it and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, location not so great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I paid 150 euros for a superior room, the room was big considering Paris hotels, very clean, nice decoration, great bed with not so great pillows, my room had a dvd player in the reception you can go for dvd at no cost. The bathroom was big although it didnt had a curtain but aside from that it had towel heater and was very good. The lobby offered good magazine aswelll as internet service ( 8 euros for 1 hour). the staff at the hotel were almost all the time very helpfull but one time that i asked for a taxi and it had arrived ten minutes eariler and they didnt bother telling me that the taxi had already arrived, generating 15 euros of a taxi i hadnt even taken. The location isnt the best for walking since its in calm residential area, theres not much to see, but you have the lamotte piquet metro station 3 minutes away, which is good or you can take a taxi for 6 euros to champss elysee, just remember the important streets suroounding the hotel because no taxi knows rue dupleix where the hotel is located, tell them to take you to lamotte piquet and suffren, then you guide them. Overall i really liked this hotel.

HotelInfo.Address: 15 Rue Dupleix | 15th Arr., 75015 Paris, France
